Reviews.Title: Nice device for a decent price
Reviews.Author: Jaymie Larkey "eclectic reader"
Reviews.Content: We live out in the sticks, and when we finally got reliable 3G broadband and a wireless network set up, I was ready to no longer share the 2 year old computer with the rest of the family and get a laptop of my own.  I use this laptop mainly for my home office: word processing, spreadsheets, internet, photo editing, and a few specific programs.  I've found this unit to be a very reasonable tool for these functions.This laptop is lightning fast, has plenty of memory, decent graphics/sound, and seems well constructed. I've read a couple of reviews that mention slow start ups, but I have not found this to be the case.  I agree that Windows 8 has a pretty big learning curve for the first few days ("intuitive", my left foot!), but after some initial frustration I was able to navigate through the program screens rather easily.  I find I still favor the "classic" laptop homescreen, but since Win 8 is app driven, that may be part of why you can have so many screens/tiles open and working with no speed lag.  I also really like that the function shortcuts are printed on the keys in blue so I'm not constantly looking them up until I memorize them.  I am not a fan of touchpads, so I like being able to quickly disable it with just a keystroke and turn on my wireless mouse instead. Bluetooth connected to all my other devices (wireless speaker, wireless headphones, my Droid X) without missing a beat.  Again, noticed no loss of speed or data with multiple connections active.Just a couple of things that bug me:1.  The CD drive is pretty flimsy.  The first time I inserted a DVD to try out the graphics, the DVD did not stay in the tray.  When I pushed the tray into the laptop, the DVD floated up and lodged in the housing above the drive.  Fortunately, I was  able to fish the DVD out using a piece of padding and some tweezers without damaging the laptop or the disk.2.  There is no caps lock/number lock indicator light.  Sounds like a small thing...until you want to do a lot of word processing.  This kind of drives me crazy.3.  Not a big fan of the shiny piano case finish on the exterior and around the screen.  Fingerprint city!  I am always wiping  the thing off so I don't look like a slob.4.  There are no programs loaded onto the laptop "as is" that are not internet driven.  I kind of enjoyed having a few games and  goodies on the old Windows formats that were available to play offline.  Bye, bye solitaire.Admittedly, the above list are small things that I like to grouse about, but they would not be enough alone to keep me from making this purchase again.  I still think this is a good machine for the money.

Reviews.Title: laptop good
Reviews.Author: goat
Reviews.Content: There are some flaws with this design but it's a solid offering at ~680$.Good stuff for the price+ Construction is fine, nothing's loose (flex below the keyboard though)+ Optical drive (not flimsy at all)+ Not too bulky+ 3rd gen i7 is fast+ Keyboard is comfortable and responsive+ Exterior design is sensible+ Internal fan is usually very quiet+ Good packaging, arrives in one pieceNot so good stuff- Display: glossy, minimum screen brightness is way too high for night reading, poor viewing angles.- Acer doesn't sell higher capacity batteries so you will have to order from some shady foreign retailer if you need one.- Bad speakers - incapable of bass & slightly muddy everywhere else, you can compensate somewhat with third party software. I personally recommend breakaway audio enhancer instead of dolby home theater.- Both the lid and touchpad deck plastic are fingerprint magnets.- Keyboard and the raised edge below it will leave marks on the screen (happens on all laptops).- Touchpad placement could be better.  It will impede left-handed typing unless temporarily disabled, or until you adjust.- Touchpad gestures are clumsy, 'unlocked' versions of the elantech touchpad driver don't actually exist. (More on this below)- No caps lock, scroll lock, or num lock indicator lights. (Arguably a good thing)- Keyboard has minor ghosting issues.Other thoughts:If you're going to install a fresh OS as I did, finding suitable touchpad drivers is incredibly difficult.  Each driver version that you can hunt down on the internet removes some features and activates others for no obvious reason.  Basically, no publicly available drivers enable all the hardware supported features at the same time.  The only way to permanently activate all of the touchpad's features (2/3/4 finger gestures, regions, scroll settings, etc..) is to edit the driver's installation config file.  Shame on elantech and acer for not having any sort of documentation or support for this.  If the stock setup is fine or if the touchpad gestures are irrelevant to you then this can be ignored.Also, you can use up to 16GB (2x8g) of ram in this pc as there are two dimm slots.  You are *not* limited to 8gb as stated in the specifications.Average cpu temp is 47-55c on a light workload, around 85c at load.No technical manual included, but you can find one online if you search around.Note that you have to hold f2 at boot to access the bios.  If you have an SSD you may have to go in there and enable 'legacy bios' to get it to boot.Also note that hardware configuration options in bios are severely limited since acer unfortunately doesn't trust its customers. The only thing you can adjust is boot order and system time.  That is all.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop, especially for the price!
Reviews.Author: Craig Boileau
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop so that I could get work done around the house instead of being chained to my desktop. I'm a software developer, so I often run virtual machines of the platforms I'm developing for. Everything runs fast and smooth. I've even played some game on this laptop, and they run great. The keyboard is extremely easy to type on. The laptop stays a very comfortable temperature, even after hours of use and while gaming. I am extremely satisfied with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Solid laptop
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: My husband is a digital media design student and we needed a new laptop for him that can handle all of the programs he needs for school.  This one is working great for him.  He's got the Microsoft Office Suite as well as the Adobe CS6 Suite on it and everything runs great.  His only complaint is Windows 8 loads slowly.

Reviews.Title: Acer is the best
Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: Acer is an often forgotten brand of laptop, however I have owned and used HPs, Dells, Toshibas, and Asus and Acer tops them all. This computer has the best touchpad, a decent keyboard, good screen, and excellent sound quality. It is fast and will process nearly all programs with speed. Great buy.

Reviews.Title: great laptop
Reviews.Author: zeph
Reviews.Content: I bought this Acer Aspire to replace my last laptop that I'd had for 5 years. it's fast, easy to use, and looks amazing.

Reviews.Title: Perfect option for working people :)
Reviews.Author: Martin Aberastegue
Reviews.Content: I really needed a new laptop to work, and I believe buying the Acer Aspire V3 was the right decision to make.I was looking for something in the sizes of 14 to 15 inches, this one is 15.6 and to be honest was a bit larger than I expected, maybe because I was used to the 14'' ones. but still being portable and it fits in my old backpack ;)The performance overall is great, the video card is the only thing you might regret if you are looking for something more powerful I think, but as I said still being the right one. Just buy it!If you are a heave Excel user, meaning needs to make a lot of calculations, this I7 microprocessor is the one for you ;).The battery is 6 cells and for me will last until 5 hours, more than I really needed but while being doing connections in several airports in the same days I really enjoyed having this battery available time.

Reviews.Title: Does what it says.
Reviews.Author: M.Dawson
Reviews.Content: Very good for the price.  Windows 8 is not as bad as everyone says.  There is a slight learning curve.  The main difference between this computer and others that are more costly is the dedicated video.  This isn't much of any issue for me for normal use.  Overall I am very happy.  Best deal on an i7 laptop.  This is my second Acer laptop.  The build quality is very good.  Feels sturdier that my Toshiba i5 I passed down.

Reviews.Title: it's Perfect
Reviews.Author: Rene Antonio Marquez Martinez
Reviews.Content: really good product and just what i expected, is get on time and is just beautiful and original botton line i love it

Reviews.Title: Good price, good quality
Reviews.Author: Kelvin Randolph
Reviews.Content: For the price and the research I did on the Acer before hand I'm happy with my purchase so far.  The only thing I really had to get use to is using Windows 8, but other than that don't have nothing bad to say.
